catalogue_raissonne: Bartsch 188 ii (vol. 8, p. 191); Pauli, Hollstein 189 ii
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: rear 3/4 view of a male peasant facing R, looking up to sky; PR hand resting on sword strapped to belt, pitchfork in PL hand; banner over figure reads "Es ist kalt Weter" (It is cold).
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in plate at top: [ES IST KALT WETER]
-- in graphite on verso: PEN 45592 | 102 | 2nd etat
markings: blue stamp on verso, LL: Collection d\'Arenberg, Lugt 567
provenance: D'Arenberg Collection, Lugt 567, Brussels and Nord-Kirchen. John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, far right: [HSB]; date in plate at upper edge: [1542]
title: Weather Peasant: Es ist kalt weter
